title: VIP-110 Set Governance as Admin in the VAI Smart contract
description:
**Summary**

In this VIP the Governance contract inherits admin of the VAI contract.

**Description**

By doing this change, Venus community will be able to authorize the Peg Stability Module contracts to mint VAI, via a normal VIP, in the following weeks. This step is part of the plan to maintain VAI pegged to $1. See more info [here](https://community.venus.io/t/proposal-deploy-the-vai-peg-stability-module-and-supply-liquidity-to-pancakeswap-for-the-vai-usdt-pair/3461).

title: VIP-111 BETH Market Deprecation
description:
**Summary**

This VIP relates to the BETH market deprecation on BNB Chain as announced earlier this week [by Binance](https://binance.com/en/support/announcement/binance-introduces-wrapped-beacon-eth-wbeth-on-eth-staking-a1197f34d832445db41654ad01f56b4d). This VIP will perform the following specific actions: 

- Borrowing will be paused for the current BETH market on Venus.


- XVS Distributions will be set to 0 for BETH market 

- Reserve factor will be increased in the BETH market to 100%


**Description **

BETH Borrowers should immediately repay their BETH Loans to avoid paying more for their BETH if a liquidity shortage happens on BNB Chain. 

Binance is rebranding ETH 2.0 Staking to ETH Staking, and introduced Wrapped Beacon ETH (WBETH) on the $ETH Staking service, on 2023-04-27 at 08:00 (UTC). 

WBETH is a new liquid stacking token. Binance has paused permanently BETH withdrawals on 2023-04-26 at 08:00 (UTC). 

To avoid risk of liquidation, we recommend users immediately reduce their exposure to BETH on Venus. 

Venus will soon be launching a new WBETH market to replace the BETH market.

title: VIP-112 Risk Parameter Updates 2023-04-25
description:
**Summary**

TRX:
Increase borrow cap to 10m tokens from 9m
Increase supply cap to 12m tokens from 11m
Increase CF to 0.50 from 0.475

SXP:
Wait for SXP suppliers to continue unwinding their positions

XVS:
Continue to monitor the price of XVS

CAKE:
Monitor CAKE market developments

title: VIP-113 Transfer XVS vault Admin privilege to Governance and Update XVS Distributions APR
description:
#### Summary

This VIP will perform the following actions: 

* Transfer vault’s Admin privileges to the Governance
* Set the new XVS Vault distribution APR to 1,100 XVS/day

#### Description 

As we continue to upgrade our vaults towards readiness for our major v4 upgrades, we are now transferring the control of the XVS Vault to the Governance to allow for a more transparent and on-chain Governance process. 

Our last buyback earlier last month for the amount of USD $477,112.93 resulted in the buyback of 62,360.02 XVS at an average buy price of $7.65. These XVS were already [sent to the Distribution wallet](https://bscscan.com/tx/0xbe399e1e15e1b7f3cb88c049f3d680c7dabdaaf318cee9d313e067afaaf638f4).

Due to various ongoing changes and audits, we were not able to adjust the XVS Vault distribution APR until today and more XVS have been distributed in the earlier weeks, thus the need to further lower the APR for the remainder of this quarter to compensate for the extra XVS that were already distributed. 

We expect the APR will return to above 9% in our next Quarter due to the excellent performances Venus has seen over the past few weeks.

title: VIP-114 Payment/Deposit to Binance Oracle
description:
**Summary**

This VIP will perform the following action:

- Transfer 100 BNB from Venus Treasury to Binance Oracle 


**Description**

This deposit is being sent to Binance Oracle for GAS that is expected to be consumed by the new Venus Binance Oracle feeds integration and expected to last for a period of around 6 months or a little more. This VIP is a dependency to Venus launching its new Isolated Markets feature as part of the major Venus v4 protocol upgrade in the upcoming weeks. 

The new Binance Oracles will be supporting most of our 20 initial new markets. 

Total to be sent: 100 BNB

title: VIP-115 Q2 2023 Payment issuance to Gauntlet
description:
**Summary**

Following the successful passing of the Snapshot proposal: Gauntlet Market Risk Management ([snapshot.org](https://snapshot.org/#/venus-xvs.eth/proposal/0x4e5e9dcae3f7b12d103ebfe8e6d95d8706815dcd97689abd9419893772f7fd4f)), and of [VIP-72](https://app.venus.io/governance/proposal/72)  Venus Protocol is now launching a new VIP proposal to issue payment to Gauntlet for Q2 2023. 

**Background**

Gauntlet provides continuous market risk management to optimize yield, capital efficiency, and mitigate depositor losses on Venus Protocol. 

Venus is issuing this VIP to pay the balance due for the Q2 2023 Service Fee for the amount of  USD $200,000.

Total to be paid USDC $200,000.

title: VIP-116 Risk Parameters Update 2023-05-09
description:
**[Recommendations](https://community.venus.io/t/risk-parameter-updates-2023-05-09/3564) From Gauntlet**

**Summary**

This VIP will perform the following actions:

- SXP: Decrease CF from 12.5% to 0%. 

- TRX: Increase CF from 50% to 52.5%.

- XVS: Increase CF from 55% to 60% and raise supply cap from 1,000,000 to 1,500,000.

Gauntlet will provide separate recommendations for IR curves that will help fully deprecate SXP and TRXOLD.

title: VIP-117 Risk Parameters Update
description:
**Summary**

This VIP will perform the following actions:


- SXP: Decrease CF from 12.5% to 0%.

- SXP: Reduce Reserves from the SXP Market and send them to the Treasury.

- SXP: Send SXP from the Treasury to Binance to be Swapped to USDT. 

- TRX: Increase CF from 50% to 52.5%.

**Description**

In view of the deprecation of SXP on BNB Chain, Venus will withdraw the available SXP interest reserves and SXP Treasury and send them to Binance to be exchanged for USDT. 

This VIP will also increase TRX Collateral Factor to 52.5% as the available liquidity on BNB Chain is seeing a healthy increase.

title: VIP-118 ETH Shortfall Repayment
description:
#### Summary 

This VIP will perform the following action: 

Repay the amount of 1,437.5 ETH debt (Approximately $2.6M) on behalf of wallet address [‘0x7589dd3355dae848fdbf75044a3495351655cb1a’](https://bscscan.com/address/0x7589dd3355dae848fdbf75044a3495351655cb1a).


#### Description

Since the adoption of Venus [Tokenomics 2.0](https://blog.venus.io/venus-tokenomics-proposal-final-version-cc9afb51bdb7) in August 2021, Venus has been accumulating reserves in its risk fund totalling $9,276,234.40. 

If approved, this proposal will use 1437.5 ETH worth of that fund to commence repayment of insolvent accounts, scheduled in the order of decreasing debt.

A VIP to use the risk fund’s remaining balance of  $6,676,234.30 will follow.

title: VIP-119 Payment Issuance to OpenZeppelin
description:
#### Summary

This VIP will perform the following actions: 

* Issue payments for 2 Audits to be performed by OpenZeppelin

#### Description 

The world's leading projects work with OpenZeppelin and so should Venus!

_OpenZeppelin_ provides security products to build, automate, and operate decentralized applications. They also protect leading organizations like (Brave, AAVE, Bancor, Ethereum, Coinbase, Optimism, Compound, BitGo) to name a few by performing security audits on their systems and products.

We are issuing this VIP to engage the auditing services of OpenZeppeling for two (2) of our upcoming major releases.

The first audit will cover our new SwapRouter, which will allow users to Swap any assets to supply them on our markets or repay their loans in one easy transaction. This will be a significant improvement in the user experience. Users will be able to supply or repay, using any tokens supported by PancakeSwap, from the same window where they currently supply and repay tokens supported by Venus.

The second audit will cover our new Oracles Smart Contracts. As Venus is the leader in this field and the first DeFi protocol to implement various simultaneous price oracles, we intend to leave nothing to chance and hope that more projects in the ecosystem will opt for such redundancy options as security and users funds should always be the priority. 

For the above mentioned reasons, Venus is issuing this VIP to pay OpenZeppelin the fees of these audits for the total amount of $252,450 to be paid in USDC.

*Note that this sum also includes a review/revision fee of $27,000. Shall there be no need to review any changes, OpenZeppelin shall return to the Venus Treasury in full or partially any or all amounts of money not having been used to perform such reviews.

title: VIP-121 BTC Shortfall Repayment
description:
**Summary** 

This VIP will perform the following action: 

Repay the amount of 90.33 BTC debt (Approximately $2.42M) on behalf of wallet address: ‘[0xef044206db68e40520bfa82d45419d498b4bc7bf](https://bscscan.com/address/0xef044206db68e40520bfa82d45419d498b4bc7bf)’.


**Description**

Since the adoption of Venus [Tokenomics 2.0](https://blog.venus.io/venus-tokenomics-proposal-final-version-cc9afb51bdb7) in August 2021, Venus has been accumulating reserves in its risk fund totalling $9,276,234.40. 

If approved, this proposal will use 90.33 BTC worth of that fund to continue repayment of insolvent accounts, scheduled in the order of decreasing debt.

More VIPs to use the risk fund’s remaining balance will follow.

title: VIP-122 Risk Parameters and Interest curve models adjustments.
description:
**Summary**

This VIP will perform the following *Risk Parameter actions* as per Gauntlet [latest recommendations](https://community.venus.io/t/risk-parameter-updates-2023-05-23/3577):

**SXP:** Lower borrow cap and supply cap to 0 to prevent new positions.

**TRX_OLD:** Lower borrow cap and supply cap to 0 to prevent new positions.

This VIP will perform the following *interest rate curve models adjustments* as per Gauntlet [latest recommendations](https://community.venus.io/t/interest-rate-curve-updates-2023-05-18/3573): 

Adjusting interest rate parameters for Tokens: BNB, ETH, BTCB, LINK, MATIC, XRP, and LTC.


**Description**

Given the significant shifts in crypto markets, Gauntlet’s platform has evaluated all assets on Venus’s active markets and has identified opportunities to adjust parameters for certain assets for the benefit of the protocol. Gauntlet’s methodology makes data-informed decisions around setting borrower and supplier interest rates when market conditions require the protocol to reduce risk or when strategic opportunities present themselves to increase protocol revenue without materially impacting risk.

title: VIP-123 Resilient Price Feeds
description:
### Summary 

If passed, this VIP will perform the following actions:

* Replace the previous price provider used in the Comptroller contract, based only on Chainlink, by the new Resilient Price Feeds
* Grant Goverance permissions to configure the Resilient Price Feeds
* Configure the price feeds in the new Resilient Price Feeds for the markets in the Venus Core pool

### Description

Proposed as a part of the Venus V4 Upgrade, Resilient Price Feeds is new logic proposed to eliminate a single point of failure while fetching asset prices from on-chain sources. It adds the capability to support multiple oracles and fallback mechanisms to return accurate prices and protect the protocol from oracle failures. Currently, it includes integrations with Chainlink, Pyth Network, Binance Oracle and TWAP (Time-Weighted Average Price) oracles, and more can be added in the future. TWAP uses PancakeSwap as the on-chain price source.

The new Resilient Price Feeds interface is configurable via VIP:

* Normal VIP: every configurable aspect
* Fast-track and Critical VIP: pause and resume the oracle, configure price feeds and set fixed prices. Just in case a quicker change would be needed

Price feeds for the 24 active markets in the Venus Core pool, plus VAI, are set in this VIP. In every case, Chainlink is used as the only price provider. New VIP’s will be proposed in the future to configure the price fallbacks and the price feeds for the upcoming markets.

#### Security and additional considerations

We applied the following security procedures for this upgrade:

* **Prices pre/post upgrade:** in a simulation environment, validating the asset prices pre-upgrade are the same as post-upgrade
* **Deployment on testnet:** the same Oracles have been deployed to testnet, and used in the Venus Protocol testnet deployment
* **Audit:** OpenZeppelin, Peckshield, Certik and Hacken have audited the deployed code

#### Audit reports

* [Peckshield audit report](https://github.com/VenusProtocol/oracle/blob/develop/audits/013_oracles_peckshield_20230424.pdf)
* [Certik audit report](https://github.com/VenusProtocol/oracle/blob/develop/audits/024_oracles_certik_20230522.pdf)
* [Hacken audit report](https://github.com/VenusProtocol/oracle/blob/develop/audits/016_oracles_hacken_20230426.pdf)

#### Deployed contracts on main net:

* [ResilientOracle](https://bscscan.com/address/0x6592b5DE802159F3E74B2486b091D11a8256ab8A)
* [ChainlinkOracle](https://bscscan.com/address/0x1B2103441A0A108daD8848D8F5d790e4D402921F)
* [BinanceOracle](https://bscscan.com/address/0x594810b741d136f1960141C0d8Fb4a91bE78A820)
* [PythOracle](https://bscscan.com/address/0xb893E38162f55fb80B18Aa44da76FaDf8E9B2262)
* [TWAPOracle](https://bscscan.com/address/0xea2f042e1A4f057EF8A5220e57733AD747ea8867)

#### References

* [Repository](https://github.com/VenusProtocol/oracle)
* [Simulation pre/post upgrade](https://github.com/VenusProtocol/vips/pull/4/)
* [Deployment on testnet](https://github.com/VenusProtocol/oracle/tree/develop/deployments/bsctestnet)
* [Community post about Venus V4, introducing Resilient Price Feeds](https://community.venus.io/t/proposing-venus-v4/3188#price-feed-redundancy-6)
* [Venus Stars blog post about Binance Oracle](https://venusstars.io/community/index.php/2023/05/09/venus-enhances-resilience-binance-oracle-feeds/)
* [Community discussion about Pyth Oracle](https://community.venus.io/t/vip-xx-integrate-with-pyth-as-an-oracle/2723/6)

title: VIP-124 Risk Parameters Adjustment for BUSD
description:
**Summary **

This VIP will perform the following action: 

- Reduce BUSD Borrow cap from 130M to 80M

**Description**

As observed by Quants in [this post](https://community.venus.io/t/reduce-busd-borrow-cap/3583), Recently, BUSD liquidity in PancakeSwap V2 has been shrinking rapidly with no sign of bouncing back: 220.30M on May 20th to 153.69M on May 31st.


We are therefore proposing to reduce our borrow cap of BUSD from 130M to 80M. The change may not have immediate impact on the protocol.

title: VIP-125 Risk Parameters Adjustment for XVS
description: Summary This VIP will perform the following action as recommended by Gauntlet in their latest risk parameters update recommendations: - Increase XVS Supply cap from 1M XVS to 1.3M XVS. Description While Gauntlet continues to monitor XVS volatility, they recommend raising the supply cap moderately to 1,300,000 from 1,000,000 as XVS supply cap usage remains > 80%. 1.3M XVS represents < 9% of its total circulating supply (14.9M) and the combined liquidity of XVS across DEX/CEXes is ample enough to mitigate significant insolvency risk due to liquidations. Gauntlet will continue to monitor market conditions and recommend additional XVS parameter changes to support the Venus community without introducing significant risk to the protocol.

title: VIP-126 Price Feeds Configuration for Isolated Markets
description: #### Summary If passed, this VIP will configure the price feeds for Venus Resilient Oracle for the following markets soon to be launched on Venus Isolated Markets: - Binance Oracle: ANKR / ankrBNB / BTT / FLOKI / HAY / NFT / RACA/ stkBNB / USDD - Chainlink: ALPACA / BIFI / BNBx / BSW / WBNB / WIN / WOO #### Description Proposed as a part of the Venus V4 Upgrade, Resilient Price Feeds is new logic eliminating a single point of failure while fetching asset prices from on-chain sources. It adds the capability to support multiple oracles and fallback mechanisms to return accurate prices and protect the protocol from oracle failures. Currently, it includes integrations with Chainlink, Pyth Network, Binance Oracle and TWAP (Time-Weighted Average Price) oracles, and more can be added in the future. TWAP uses PancakeSwap as the on-chain price source. We query prices from the Binance Oracle by using just the asset string names, via the FeedRegistry. So, no explicit price feed configuration is needed. Price feeds used from Chainlink: - ALPACA: 0xe0073b60833249ffd1bb2af809112c2fbf221df6 (source) - BIFI: 0xab827b69dacd586a37e80a7d552a4395d576e645 (source) - BNBx: 0xc4429B539397a3166eF3ef132c29e34715a3ABb4 (source) - BSW: 0x08e70777b982a58d23d05e3d7714f44837c06a21 (source) - WBNB: 0x0567f2323251f0aab15c8dfb1967e4e8a7d42aee (source) - WIN: 0x9e7377e194e41d63795907c92c3eb351a2eb0233 (source) - WOO: 0x02bfe714e78e2ad1bb1c2bee93ec8dc5423b66d4 (source) #### Security and additional considerations This VIP doesn’t imply any changes in the code, only changes in the configuration of the already deployed contracts. Prices post set-up: in a simulation environment, validating the Venus Resilient Price Feeds returns the expected prices after applying this set-up.

title: VIP-127 Vault Updrades
description: #### Summary If passed this VIP will perform the following actions: * XVS Vault: XVS that has been requested for withdrawal will not accrue rewards from the moment of the request * VRT Vault: stop rewarding users since June 15th, 2023, 00:00 GMT, and transfer the ownership to Governance * Fast-track and Critical VIP's will be able to pause and resume the XVS Vault, VAI Vault and VRT Vault #### Description This VIP upgrades the implementation of the three vaults in Venus: XVS Vault, VAI Vault and VRT Vault. This upgrade enables several new features: * Proposed as a part of the Venus Tokenomics, when users request a withdrawal in the XVS Vault, those balances will no longer qualify for earning staking rewards, they will be considered already liquid and withdrawn from the vault. * Stop rewards to the VRT vault as VRT has been deprecated and will no longer be supported on Venus nor BNB Chain. The last block number where VRT rewards will be distributed in the vault is 29108355 (Estimated Target Date: Tue Jun 15th 2023 00:00:00 GMT). * Fast-track and Critical VIP’s are authorized to pause and resume the vaults, following the guidelines of Venus V4. Normal VIP’s will continue being used for regular updates, but from now on the community will be able to pause and resume the vaults quickly. Finally, this VIP will transfer the remaining vaults Admin privileges to the Governance. #### Extra consideration in the XVS Vault Please note that if you have requested a XVS withdrawal prior to this upgrade, you will not be able to interact with the vault until your XVS is unlocked and after you have completed your withdrawal. This only applies to requests created before the upgrade that will be applied once this VIP is executed. If you request a withdrawal after we upgrade the vault, and you didn't have any pending withdrawal request, you will be able to interact with the vault as usual (claim rewards, request new withdrawal or deposit more XVS). We recommend the following to the users: * If you are planning to request a withdrawal in the XVS Vault, please, wait until the VIP is executed. * If you have pending withdrawal requests that cannot be executed yet, and you want to deposit more XVS or claim rewards, please, do it before the VIP executes. Otherwise, you'll have to wait until you execute your existing pending withdrawals before you can interact with the vault again. #### Security and additional considerations We applied the following security procedures for this upgrade: * XVS Vault status pre/post upgrade: in a simulation environment, validating withdrawal requests, withdrawal executions, and pending rewards work as expected after the upgrade * Pause/Resume of vaults post upgrade: in a simulation environment, validating pause and resume features work as expected in the three vaults after the upgrade. * Deployment on testnet: the same vaults have been deployed to testnet, and used in the Venus Protocol testnet deployment * Audit: Quantstamp, Certik, Peckshield and Fairyproof have audited the deployed code #### Audit reports (Links will be enabled after the execution of the VIP) * Quantstamp audit report * Peckshield audit report 1 * Peckshield audit report 2 * Fairyproof audit report #### Deployed contracts on main net * New XVSVault implementation * New VAIVault implementation * New VRTVault implementation #### Fork tests (simulations) * https://github.com/VenusProtocol/venus-protocol/blob/develop/tests/hardhat/XVS/XVSVaultFix.ts * https://github.com/VenusProtocol/venus-protocol/blob/develop/tests/hardhat/Fork/XVSVaultUpgrade.ts * https://github.com/VenusProtocol/venus-protocol/blob/develop/tests/hardhat/Fork/VAIVaultUpgrade.ts * https://github.com/VenusProtocol/venus-protocol/blob/develop/tests/hardhat/Fork/VRTVaultUpgrade.ts #### References * Repository * Simulation pre/post upgrade * Community post about Venus V4, introducing Fast-track and Critical VIP’s * Tokenomics, introducing the upgrade of the XVS Vault * XVSVaultProxy contract * VAIVaultProxy contract * VRTVaultProxy contract

title: VIP-128 Add WBETH market to the Venus Core pool
description: #### Summary As part ot the BETH token deprecation and rebranding to WBETH as previously addressed in VIP-111, if passed this VIP will perform the following actions: * Add a new market in the Core pool for the token WBETH (wrapped Binance ETH). * Upgrade the BinanceOracle contract to support the new market #### Description A new market for WBETH will be added to the Core pool. The risk parameters of the new market are: * Collateral factor: 50% * Supply cap: 300 WBETH * Borrow cap: 200 WBETH * Reserver factor: 20% * XVS Distributions: 34.34/Day These parameters will be monitored and adjusted if needed in the future. Moreover, in order to support the new market, it was needed to upgrade the implementation of the BinanceOracle contract. This upgrade translates the wBETH symbol of the token to WBETH, as expected by the Binance Oracle system. #### Security and additional considerations We applied the following security procedures for this upgrade: * Add WBETH in a simulation environment: we added the new market to the Core pool, and we verified everything works as expected * Deployment on testnet: the same market for WBETH has been deployed to testnet, and used in the Venus Protocol testnet deployment * Security review: Peckshield and Certik reviewed the change done in the BinanceOracle contract 5.499943 WBETH will be initially provided, as bootstrap liquidity for this market.This mitigates potential attacks on empty pools previously observed in other Lending protocols. The vTokens minted with this bootstrap liquidity are sent to Binance Simple Earn, the liquidity provider. #### Deployed contracts on main net * vWBETH (new market): 0x6CFdEc747f37DAf3b87a35a1D9c8AD3063A1A8A0 * BinanceOracle (new implementation): 0xe38AbE42948ef249E84f4e935e4f56483C1EE3B9 #### Fork tests (simulations) * https://github.com/VenusProtocol/vips/pull/26 #### References * Repository * WBETH token in BNB chain * vWBETH (new market) on testnet: 0x35566ED3AF9E537Be487C98b1811cDf95ad0C32b * Binance Introduces Wrapped Beacon ETH (WBETH) on ETH Staking

title: VIP-129 TUSD Contract Migration
description: #### Summary This VIP relates to the TUSD contract migration on BNB Chain as announced earlier this month. If passed this VIP will perform the following actions: * Deploy a new market, with the new BEP20 TUSD contract as underlying * Actions to start the process of deprecating the current market with the old BEP20 TUSD contract as underlying #### Description Following the Gauntlet recommendations, the detailed list of changes that would be done if this VIP passes are: * Borrowing, supplying and enabling TUSD as collateral will be paused for the current TUSD market on Venus. It will be renamed to ‘TUSDOLD’. * XVS distribution will be set to 0 for ‘TUSDOLD’ market and set to 12.5 XVS per day in the new TUSD market. * Reserve factor will be increased in the ‘TUSDOLD’ market, to 100% * Collateral factor will be decreased in the ‘TUSDOLD’ market, to 55% * Upgrade the legacy vTUSD market, to use a different name: "Venus TUSDOLD" * Add a new market, using the new BEP20 TUSD contract as underlying. Until sufficient liquidity is in place, Gauntlet Network has recommended the following settings: - CF: 0% - reserve factor: 25% - borrow cap: 600,000 TUSD - supply cap: 1,000,000 TUSD #### Security and additional considerations We applied the following security procedures for this upgrade: * Old vTUSD and New vTUSD markets post upgrade: in a simulation environment, we added the new market to the Core pool, we executed the actions on the old market, and we verified everything works as expected * Deployment on testnet: the same VIP has been executed on testnet, and the changes have been verified TUSD Borrowers should immediately repay their TUSDOLD Loans to avoid paying more for their TUSD if a liquidity shortage happens. 10,000 TUSD will be initially provided, as bootstrap liquidity for this market. This mitigates potential attacks on empty pools previously observed in other Lending protocols. The vTokens minted with this bootstrap liquidity are sent to the Venus Community Delegators, the liquidity providers. #### Deployed contracts on main net * Old TUSD token: 0x14016E85a25aeb13065688cAFB43044C2ef86784 * New TUSD token: 0x40af3827F39D0EAcBF4A168f8D4ee67c121D11c9 * Old vTUSD market: 0x08CEB3F4a7ed3500cA0982bcd0FC7816688084c3 * New vTUSD market: 0xBf762cd5991cA1DCdDaC9ae5C638F5B5Dc3Bee6E #### Deployed contracts on test net * Old vTUSD market: 0x3A00d9B02781f47d033BAd62edc55fBF8D083Fb0 * New vTUSD market: 0xEFAACF73CE2D38ED40991f29E72B12C74bd4cf23 #### Fork tests (simulations) * https://github.com/VenusProtocol/vips/pull/25 #### References * Repository * Gauntlet recommendations for TUSD * Binance Will Support the TrueUSD (TUSD) Contract Swap * Binance Has Completed the TrueUSD (TUSD) Contract Swap

title: VIP-130 Risk Parameters Adjustment
description: Summary If passed this VIP will perform the following Risk Parameter actions as per Gauntlet Network’s latest recommendations: XVS: Raise supply cap from 1.3M XVS to 1.5M XVS SXP: Raise base multiplier to .15 to .30 (Raise borrow APR to ~100%) TRX_OLD: Raise base multiplier from .15 to 1.0 (Raise borrow APR to ~100%). BETH: Decrease collateral factor to 0.50 from 0.60 and decrease borrow and supply cap to 0. WBETH: Raise Supply Cap from 300 WBETH to 800 WBETH and Raise Borrow cap from 200 WBETH to 550 WBETH. Description Gauntlet’s parameter updates seek to maintain the overall risk tolerance of the protocol while making risk trade-offs between specific assets. Gauntlet’s parameter recommendations are driven by an optimization function that balances 3 core metrics: insolvencies, liquidations, and borrow usage. Parameter recommendations seek to optimize for this objective function. Gauntlet’s agent-based simulations use a wide array of varied input data that changes daily (including but not limited to asset volatility, asset correlation, asset collateral usage, DEX / CEX liquidity, trading volume, the expected market impact of trades, and liquidator behavior). Gauntlet’s simulations tease out complex relationships between these inputs that cannot be expressed as heuristics. The individual collateral pages on the Venus Risk Dashboard cover other vital statistics and outputs from Gauntlet’s simulations that can help with understanding interesting inputs and results related to their simulations. To learn more about Gauntlet’s methodologies, please see the Quick Links section at the bottom of their Forum post.

title: VIP-131 Add PancakeSwap integration for simple repay and supply using a different token
description: #### Summary If passed this VIP will perform the following actions: * Ownership of the new contract interacting with PancakeSwap to allow the supply and repay in Venus using a different token will be transferred to Governance * XVSStore admin will be transferred to Governance #### Description Proposed as a part of the Venus V4 Upgrade, we are making the supply and repayment processes easier in Venus, allowing users to use a token that differs from the underlying one. This is achieved by integrating PancakeSwap V2 to exchange these tokens for the required asset before initiating the supply or repay transactions. In this VIP, the ownership of the developed contract will be transferred to Governance. After the execution of the VIP, the UI deployed at https://app.venus.io will be upgraded to support the new contract. Finally, related to VIP-113, this VIP will transfer the control of the XVSStore contract (where the XVSVault rewards are held) to Governance to allow for a more transparent and on-chain Governance process. #### Security and additional considerations We applied the following security procedures for this upgrade: * Audit: OpenZeppelin, Certik, Peckshield and Hacken have audited the deployed code * Simulations: in a simulation environment, forked from the mainnet, supplies and repayments using different tokens were executed and verified. * Deployment on testnet: the same contract has been deployed to testnet, and used in the Venus Protocol testnet deployment. Some PancakeSwap pairs were manually created with the underlying tokens enabled at the testnet deployment. * VIP simulation: in a simulation environment, the execution of this VIP has been verified #### Audit reports * OpenZeppelin audit report - 2023/06/16 * Certik audit report - 2023/05/30 * Peckshield audit report - 2023/04/19 #### Deployed contracts on main net * SwapRouter contract on mainnet #### Fork tests (simulations) * https://github.com/VenusProtocol/venus-protocol/blob/develop/tests/hardhat/Swap/swapTest.ts #### References * Repository * XVSStore contract deployed on mainnet * VIP simulation * Community post about Venus V4, introducing Integrated Swap and DEX

title: VIP-132 Risk Parameters Adjustment
description: Summary This VIP is a re-launch of VIP-130. Due to a definition problem caused by a white space in the command being unrecognized by Venus Comptroller, its execution is being blocked. If passed this VIP will perform the following Risk Parameter actions as per Gauntlet Network’s latest recommendations: XVS: Raise supply cap from 1.3M XVS to 1.5M XVS SXP: Raise base multiplier to .15 to .30 (Raise borrow APR to ~100%) TRX_OLD: Raise base multiplier from .15 to 1.0 (Raise borrow APR to ~100%). BETH: Decrease collateral factor to 0.50 from 0.60 and decrease borrow and supply cap to 0. WBETH: Raise Supply Cap from 300 WBETH to 800 WBETH and Raise Borrow cap from 200 WBETH to 550 WBETH. Description Gauntlet’s parameter updates seek to maintain the overall risk tolerance of the protocol while making risk trade-offs between specific assets. Gauntlet’s parameter recommendations are driven by an optimization function that balances 3 core metrics: insolvencies, liquidations, and borrow usage. Parameter recommendations seek to optimize for this objective function. Gauntlet’s agent-based simulations use a wide array of varied input data that changes daily (including but not limited to asset volatility, asset correlation, asset collateral usage, DEX / CEX liquidity, trading volume, the expected market impact of trades, and liquidator behavior). Gauntlet’s simulations tease out complex relationships between these inputs that cannot be expressed as heuristics. The individual collateral pages on the Venus Risk Dashboard cover other vital statistics and outputs from Gauntlet’s simulations that can help with understanding interesting inputs and results related to their simulations. To learn more about Gauntlet’s methodologies, please see the Quick Links section at the bottom of their Forum post.

title: VIP-133 Enable Tokenomics v3.1 and Allocate Legacy XVS Rewards to the XVS Vault
description: Summary This VIP has for objective the ratification of the previous Snapshot vote: Venus Protocol Proposal: Update to Venus Protocol Tokenomics (3.1) and if passed, it will also allocate legacy XVS market rewards to the XVS Vault Rewards smart contract. Description It has been approximately one year since the last revision to Venus Tokenomics and given the continuing evolution of the market, Venus has re-evaluated and suggested an optimal distribution of income given the protocol’s current and future needs that was voted and agreed to by the community. Also, In preparation for our new Quarterly Buyback and Tokenomics allocation, this VIP Proposal will allocate legacy XVS market rewards to the XVS Vault in accordance with the new Tokenomics. The last legacy XVS rewards allocation was made in the early months of 2022 with VIP-91 for a period of 6 months, hence the necessity to top-up the Vault Rewards for another 6 months period. June 30, 2023 to December 31, 2023 = 184 Days. This VIP will allocate 184 x 1050 = 193,200 XVS to the vault rewards distribution contract. Please note that the XVS vault daily emissions will be adjusted in a future VIP once our quarterly buyback is completed. Conclusion The proposed revisions in Venus Protocol Tokenomics are expected to yield positive results for the Venus ecosystem, ensuring a fairer distribution of income and enhancing the platform’s sustainability.

title: VIP-134 Isolated pools: deployment stage 1
description: #### Summary If passed, this VIP will perform the following actions: * Add pool "Stablecoins" to the new Pool Registry contract * Add the following markets to the new Stablecoins pool as per forum proposals: - HAY - USDT - USDD #### Description Stablecoins is the first isolated pool in the Venus Protocol. This VIP is part of the deployment plan defined for isolated pools, with a progressive release of new pools and markets, and a continued adjustment of risk parameters. The following stages are: 2) deployment of the remaining launch pools (Tron, DeFi, Liquid Staked BNB, GameFi) 3) adjustment of the risk parameters for all isolated markets 4) enable rewards provided by community launch partners Initial “deployment” risk parameters specific for each new market in the Stablecoins pool: * Underlying token: HAY - Borrow cap: 200,000 - Supply cap: 500,000 - Collateral factor: 0.65 - Liquidation threshold: 0.7 - Reserve factor: 0.2 * Underlying token: USDT - Borrow cap: 400,000 - Supply cap: 1,000,000 - Collateral factor: 0.8 - Liquidation threshold: 0.88 - Reserve factor: 0.1 * Underlying token: USDD - Borrow cap: 400,000 - Supply cap: 1,000,000 - Collateral factor: 0.65 - Liquidation threshold: 0.7 - Reserve factor: 0.1 Initial interest rate curves for the new markets: * Underlying token: HAY - kink: 0.8 - base (yearly): 0.02 - multiplier (yearly): 0.1 - jump multiplier (yearly): 3 * Underlying token: USDT - kink: 0.6 - base (yearly): 0.02 - multiplier (yearly): 0.05 - jump multiplier (yearly): 2.5 * Underlying token: USDD - kink: 0.8 - base (yearly): 0.02 - multiplier (yearly): 0.1 - jump multiplier (yearly): 3 Bootstrap liquidity: * 25,000 HAY - provided by the Helio Protocol * 10,000 USDT - provided by the Venus Treasury * 10,000 USDD - provided by the Tron project Initial risk parameters for the Stablecoins pool (similar to the ones used in the Core pool): * Close factor: 50% * Liquidation incentive: 10% Extra liquidity mining rewards provided by our launch partners are not initially configured. They will be configured at the conclusion of the deployment plan, after adjusting the risk parameters. #### Security and additional considerations We applied the following security procedures for this upgrade: * Audit: Certik, Peckshield, Hacken and Code4rena have audited the deployed code * VIP execution simulation: in a simulation environment, validating the markets are properly added to the pool with the right parameters and the expected bootstrap liquidity * Deployment on testnet: the same pool has been deployed to testnet, and used in the Venus Protocol testnet deployment * Fork tests: in a simulation environment, verifying the main actions of the protocol are executable as expected with real data The ownership of every contract has been transferred to Governance. In this VIP, apart from the Normal VIP’s, Fast-track and Critical VIP’s are also enabled to execute some of the configurable actions on the new contracts. #### Audit reports * Certik audit report (2023/June/19) * Code4rena contest (2023/May/05) * Hacken audit report (2023/April/26) * Peckshield audit report 1 (2023/January/12) * Peckshield audit report 2 (2023/June/25) #### Contracts on mainnet * Pool registry: 0x9F7b01A536aFA00EF10310A162877fd792cD0666 * Comptroller for the Stablecoins pool: 0x94c1495cD4c557f1560Cbd68EAB0d197e6291571 * Markets: - vHAY: 0xCa2D81AA7C09A1a025De797600A7081146dceEd9 - vUSDD: 0xc3a45ad8812189cAb659aD99E64B1376f6aCD035 - vUSDT: 0x5e3072305F9caE1c7A82F6Fe9E38811c74922c3B * Underlying tokens: - HAY: 0x0782b6d8c4551b9760e74c0545a9bcd90bdc41e5 - USDD: 0xd17479997f34dd9156deef8f95a52d81d265be9c - USDT: 0x55d398326f99059ff775485246999027b3197955 * Pool lens: 0xe12da02820fAD83e0369C6De7Ae30721eaB60E32 * Swap router for Stablecoins: 0x50d8ac56FC8525dcA9F41b12De0dbc6bDf7771e3 #### Contracts on testnet * Pool registry: 0xC85491616Fa949E048F3aAc39fbf5b0703800667 * Comptroller for the Stablecoins pool: 0x10b57706ad2345e590c2ea4dc02faef0d9f5b08b * Markets: - vHAY: 0x170d3b2da05cc2124334240fB34ad1359e34C562 - vUSDD: 0x899dDf81DfbbF5889a16D075c352F2b959Dd24A4 - vUSDT: 0x3338988d0beb4419Acb8fE624218754053362D06 * Pool lens: 0x559936086C5f65b92240012ae0D2F70C082Ac0b0 #### References * Repository * Fork tests of main operations * VIP simulation * Community post about Venus V4, introducing Isolated Pools

title: VIP-135 Increase WBETH Supply Cap
description: Summary If passed, this VIP will perform the following action: - Increase WBETH Supply Cap from 800 to 4000. Description Since the supply cap for WBETH is getting reached almost immediately each time its increased, Gauntlet recommends an agressive approach (while still taking into account developing liquidity) is warranted. WBETH has adequate CEX liquidity to justify this increase without introducing significant liquidity concentration risk to the protocol, especially given that its CF is very conservatively set at 50% currently. Further, WBETH price is 1:1 with BETH, both assets' supply balances on Venus are similar currently, and WBETH stands to offer a lot of value to Venus with users implementing a LSD-recursive strategy. Thus, Gauntlet feels a 4,000 WBETH supply cap is justified. This recommendation intends to prevent the supply cap from being hit rapidly after the change. Gauntlet will continue to monitor Venus markets and deliver their next set of recommendations on July 5 to incorporate additional cap adjustments, post-execution of the updated 4,000 supply cap should it be maxed out quickly again.

title: VIP-137 XVS Quarterly Buyback and Funds Allocation
description: VIP-137 relates to the Quarterly Venus Protocol XVS Buyback & Funds allocation as indicated in our Tokenomics. #### Specifications As per our Tokenomics v.3.1, this VIP will proceed to withdraw funds for our Quarterly Buyback and distributions. The complete details on our latest tokenomics are available here: Revision of Venus Tokenomics As the community approved in the previous Snapshot Vote and VIP Proposal, these new Tokenomics became effective immediately and are inclusive of the Venus Q2 Revenues. Please note that since the Vaults on Venus are now controlled by the Governance, a second VIP will be necessary to allocate the buyback XVS Tokens to the Vault rewards distribution contract and set the new XVS Vault distribution speed once the buyback is completed.

title: VIP-138 Payments for performed Audits and OpenZeppelin Security partnership
description: Description If passed this VIP will perform the following actions: - Transfer 18,000 USDC to Peckshield for the Diamond Comptroller audit - Transfer 6,000 USDC to Peckshield for the Oracle upgrade audit - Transfer 19,000 USDT to Certik for the retainer program - Transfer 20,000 USDT to Fairyproof for the Automatic income allocation audit - Transfer 277,200 USDC to OpenZeppelin for the security partnership Details Peckshield - Diamond Comptroller - Auditor: Peckshield (https://peckshield.com) - Payload: Diamond Comptroller (https://github.com/VenusProtocol/venus-protocol/pull/224). Upgrade of the Comptroller contract in the Venus Core pool, to resolve the limit of the contract size (see EIP-170) - Status: first set of findings shared, and mitigations applied. Waiting for the final report. - Cost: 18,000 USDC (1.5 persons/week), to be sent to the BEP20 address 0x24ee02a67c64f66ca5bcf9352f6701b46dcedff1 Peckshield - Oracle upgrade - Auditor: Peckshield (https://peckshield.com) - Payload: Oracle upgrade (https://github.com/VenusProtocol/oracle/pull/65 and https://github.com/VenusProtocol/oracle/pull/101). This upgrade enables price queries on any token address, not only for the Venus VTokens. This increases the use case of the system, for example in the Shortfall handling - Status: first set of findings shared, and working on mitigations. - Cost: 6,000 USDC (2.5 persons/day), to be sent to the BNB address 0x24ee02a67c64f66ca5bcf9352f6701b46dcedff1 Certik - retainer program - Auditor: Certik (https://certik.com) - Concept: Retainer program - monthly payment of July 2023. Scheduled audits by Certik in July: Oracle upgrade, Diamond Comptroller and RewardsDistributor for Isolated pools - Cost: 19,000 USDT, to be sent to the BEP20 address 0x4cf605b238e9c3c72d0faed64d12426e4a54ee12 Fairyproof - Automatic income allocation - Auditor: Fairyproof (https://www.fairyproof.com) - Payload: Automatic income allocation. Distribute the reserves generated in the protocol, in an automatic way, following the agreed Tokenomics Status: audit starts on July 10th, 2023 - Cost: 20,000 USDT (10 working days), to be sent to the BEP20 address 0x083a394785f20b244e0697c08f0e01874fde801f OpenZeppelin - security partnership - Auditor: OpenZeppelin (https://openzeppelin.com/) - Concept: OpenZeppelin Security partnership - first payment - Cost: 277,200 USDC, to be sent to the BEP20 address 0x5e101FCa7a2BAB7877972bc85A1a07A2606A31B9 As per the recently submitted proposal and snapshot vote, OpenZeppelin will be performing continuous Security Audits on retainer and has already started their audit work for several upcoming new products and features on Venus.

title: VIP-139 - Critical Update - Remove BIFI Market
description: Summary This VIP if passed will perform the following actions: - Pause Supply on the BIFI Market - Pause Borrow on the BIFI market - Pause enter BIFI market function - Set the Reserve Factor to 100% on the BIFI Market Description Beefy’s bridging provider Multichain has suffered a series of critical failures affecting all assets issued and supported by their protocol, $BIFI being one of those. As a preventative measure to avoid financial harm to $BIFI holders, Beefy is now recommending that all users exit any existing liquidity pool positions involving the $BIFI token. This directly affects the liquidation capabilities of Venus Markets. Beefy is working on a token re-issuance and the market will be launched as soon as possible. The decision to cancel the market launch immediately and wait for the new $BIFI token to be issued will also avoid Venus and its users having to go through another contract swap.

title: VIP-140 Isolated Lending Pools: Configure Liquidity Mining
description: #### Summary If passed, this VIP will perform the following actions: * Accept ownership over the new RewardsDistributor contracts * Withdraw initial rewards from treasury * Set rewards speeds for each market #### Description This VIP is another step forward to the official launch of our brand new isolated lending pools! We have been working tirelessly to bring innovative features that will further enhance our users' experience. These pools are designed to provide Venus users with a safe and efficient way to lend their assets and earn attractive returns. We have put in place advanced risk management protocols to ensure the security of users' funds but that's not all! We have also partnered with our launch partners to bring you exciting liquidity mining rewards. Our partners have generously pledged substantial liquidity mining rewards to incentivize and reward our users. This means that by participating in our isolated lending markets, you not only earn interest on your assets but also have the opportunity to earn additional rewards.We understand the importance of supporting our community and providing you with valuable opportunities. We couldn't be more excited about this release and the opportunities it brings to our community. We encourage you to explore our new isolated lending pools! #### Security and additional considerations We applied the following security procedures for this upgrade: * Audit: Certik, Peckshield, Hacken and Code4rena have audited the deployed code Audit reports * Certik audit report 1 (2023/June/19) * Certik audit report 2 (2023/July/10) * Code4rena contest (2023/May/05) * Hacken audit report (2023/April/26) * Peckshield audit report 1 (2023/January/12) * Peckshield audit report 2 (2023/June/25)

title: VIP-145 Upgrade of the Resilient Price Feeds
description: #### Summary If passed, this VIP will perform the following actions: * Upgrade the contract’s implementations of the Resilient Price Feeds * Configure the price feed for the SD token #### Description This upgrade includes a new function in the Resilient Price Feeds (VIP-123) that will allow anyone to get the price of an asset, providing the asset address. Previously, the vToken contract address associated with the asset had to be provided. This enables the possibility of configuring price feeds for assets not listed in the Venus markets. This is needed, for example, to calculate the Distribution APY of the rewards in the Venus UI. Moreover, this VIP configures the price feed of the SD token (0x3bc5ac0dfdc871b365d159f728dd1b9a0b5481e8 in BNB chain), using the Binance Oracle as a provider. #### Security and additional considerations We applied the following security procedures for this upgrade: * Prices pre/post upgrade: in a simulation environment, validating the asset prices pre-upgrade are the same as post-upgrade * Deployment on testnet: the same Oracles have been deployed to testnet, and used in the Venus Protocol testnet deployment * Audit: Peckshield and Certik have audited the updated code #### Audit reports * Peckshield audit report * Certik audit report #### References * Repository * Simulation pre/post upgrade * Deployment on testnet * Documentation

title: VIP-157 Peg Stability Module
description: #### Summary If passed, this VIP will perform the following actions: * Enable the Peg Stability Module (PSM) contract for VAI and USDT * Set the VAI base rate to 4% #### Description This VIP enables the Peg Stability Module, allowing anyone to convert USDT for VAI and vice versa. The PSM was proposed to the Venus community in the post “PROPOSAL: Deploy the VAI PEG Stability module and Supply Liquidity to PancakeSwap for the VAI/USDT Pair”, and accepted in this Snapshot proposal. The following parameters will be set following the recommendations of Steakhouse shared in the community forum: Setting the PSM fees and change VAI borrowings parameters Config parameters (they can be updated in the future with another VIP): * PSM/USDT feeIn: 0bps (to be applied when the user sends USDT to the contract to receive VAI) * PSM/USDT feeOut: 10bps (to be applied when the user sends VAI to the contract to receive USDT) * Maximum amount of VAI generated in the PSM: 5M VAI * Bootstrap liquidity: 219,000 USDT, provided by the Venus Treasury, that will receive the equivalent amount of VAI Moreover, this VIP will update the VAI base rate from 1% to 4%. #### Extra considerations for the PSM There will be a PSM contract deployed for each pair VAI - Stablecoin. This VIP enables the PSM contract for VAI - USDT. In the future, new VIPs can be proposed to enable new PSM contracts with different stablecoins. Each enabled PSM must be authorized to mint VAI. This VIP authorizes the PSM for VAI - USDT to do that. The fees generated in the PSM (always in VAI) will be sent to the Venus Treasury. The PSM contract fixes the conversion rate 1 VAI = $1, not 1 VAI = 1 USDT. It uses the Resilient Price Feeds enabled on VIP-123 to get the USD value of the USDT on each transaction. Initially, the expected main use cases for the PSM contract will be: * Open arbitrages opportunities with the exchanges, keeping the VAI price closer to $1: * If the VAI price in PancakeSwap (PCS), for example, is below $1, bots will buy VAI in PCS (pushing up the VAI price closer to $1) and they will send it to the PSM, getting more USDT. * If the VAI price in any exchange is above $1, bots will send USDT to the PSM, getting VAI that they will sell in the exchanges (pushing down the VAI price closer to $1), getting more USDT. * Aggregators like 1inch could integrate the PSM in their available swapping routes. #### Security and additional considerations We applied the following security procedures for this upgrade: * Unit and fork tests: in a simulation environment, validating the PSM contract works as expected * VIP simulation: in a simulation environment, validating the VIP is executed as expected * Deployment on testnet: the same PSM has been deployed to testnet, and used in the Venus Protocol testnet deployment * Audit: Quantstamp, Certik, Peckshield and Hacken have audited the deployed code #### Audit reports * Quantstamp audit report * Certik audit report * Peckshield audit report * Hacken audit report #### Deployed contracts * Mainnet: PSM for VAI/USDT * Testnet: PSM for VAI/USDT #### References * Repository * Unit tests * Fork tests * VIP simulation * Community post proposing the PSM for VAI/USDT * Snapshot proposal for the PSM * Documentation

title: VIP-161 Initiate BUSD market deprecation and Risk Parameters Updates
description: Summary If passed this VIP will perform the following actions as per the latest Chaos Labs recommendations: * BUSD: Pause MINT, Pause BORROW, Pause ENTER_MARKET - Users that have already enabled BUSD as collateral will not be affected by this update. Set XVS rewards in the BUSD market to 0.Freeze new supply and borrow by reducing supply and borrow caps to 0 and Increase BUSD Reserve Factor to 100% * TUSDOLD: Reduce jump multiplier from 2.5 to 0.5 * ankrBNB (Defi Pool): Increase supply cap by 2X to 10,000 Rationale Given the ongoing deprecation of BUSD by Paxos leading to increasing risk due to reduced liquidity, Chaos Labs recommend gradually winding down the BUSD market on Venus. As announced by PAXOS, the original issuer of BUSD, they have already halted minting New BUSD Tokens. Existing Tokens Remain Fully-Backed and Redeemable Through Binance or the Paxos Trust Company Through at Least February 2024. * Paxos Will Halt Minting New BUSD Tokens * Paxos will continue supporting BUSD until at least February 2024 * Binance started delisting BUSD pairs * Coinbase has already stopped BUSD trading This proposal aims to initiate the deprecation of BUSD from the Venus market. If the community agrees to deprecate BUSD, Chaos Labs proposes a phased plan comprising the following actions: * Limit exposure to BUSD on Venus * Freeze new supply and borrow * Gradually reduce Collateral Factors to allow users to repay or swap their collaterals * Encourage repayment of BUSD loans by amending IR curves * Encourage redemption of BUSD supply by reducing supply interest - increasing Reserve Factors Following each update, Chaos Labs will continue to monitor the market and the impact of the parameter updates on usage. Based on the observed effects and future market conditions, they will continue to supply recommendations as necessary.

title: VIP-170 Risk fund foundation
description: #### Summary If passed, this VIP will set the ProtocolShareReserve and Shortfall contracts to be used on each market of the Isolated Pools. It also configures the RiskFund contract, that will provide to the Shortfall contract the funds to be auctioned, to cover any future bad debt (in case any are generated) in the markets of the Isolated Pools. This VIP enables the Stage 1 described in the following community post. #### Description This VIP sets the ProtocolShareReserve and Shortfall contracts in every current market in Isolated Pools. The ProtocolShareReserve contract is the contract where the reserves are sent from a market when they are withdrawn. Until now, the configured target of the reserves of Isolated Pools was the Venus Treasury. The new ProtocolShareReserve contract will distribute the received reserves following the Venus Tokenomics; 50% of the reserves withdrawn from the markets in the Isolated Pools will be sent to the RiskFund contract. Remaining funds will be sent to the Venus Treasury. If the conditions to perform an auction of the bad debt in any of the Isolated Pools are satisfied, the funds held by the RiskFund contract will be used by the Shortfall contract to auction them, getting tokens to reduce the associated bad debt. These auctions can be initiated and participated in a permissionless fashion. Main parameters in the Shortfall contract and the values initially set: * Minimum USD bad debt in the pool to allow the initiation of an auction. Initial value: 1,000 USD * Blocks to wait for the first bidder. Initial value: 100 blocks * Time to wait for the next bidder. Initial value: 100 blocks * Incentive to auction participants. Initial value: 1000 bps (or 10%) Expected operational tasks: * Funds will be sent from the markets to the ProtocolShareReserve contract, invoking the _reduceReserves_ function on each market. Anyone can do this, at any moment. * Funds will be distributed from the ProtocolShareReserve, sending part of it to the RiskFund contract, invoking the _releaseFunds_ function on the ProtocolShareReserve contract. Anyone can do this, at any moment. * The manager address will swap the tokens received in the RiskFund contract for USDT There will be more VIPs in the future to enable the rest of the stages described in this community post. The allocation of the income generated in the Core pool is more complex. As soon as the “Automatic income allocation” release is ready, a VIP will be proposed to upgrade the ProtocolShareReserve contract and link the markets from the Core pool, so the risk fund will automatically be fed with the right amount of funds from all the Venus markets (Isolated Pools and Core pool). Finally, this VIP will authorize Normal, Fast-track and Critical timelocks to configure the risk parameters of the Shortfall and RiskFund contracts. The guardian address is also authorized to pause and resume auctions in the Shortfall contract. The manager address is authorized to swap the tokens received in the RiskFund for USDT, using PancakeSwap V2 for it. #### Security and additional considerations We applied the following security procedures for this upgrade: * Configuration post upgrade: in a simulation environment, validating every contract is properly set after the VIP * Fork tests: in a simulation environment, validating the RiskFund, ProtocolShareReserve and Shortfall contracts work as expected * Deployment on testnet: the same configuration has been deployed to testnet, and used in the Venus Protocol testnet deployment * Audit: the deployed and configured contracts were in the scope of the audits done before the launch of Isolated Pools in the VIP-134. Apart from those audits, the following specific audits have been done * Certik audit report (2023/August/24) * Peckshield audit report (2023/August/25) #### Deployed contracts to mainnet * ProtocolShareReserve * Shortfall * RiskFund #### Deployed contracts to testnet * ProtocolShareReserve * Shortfall * RiskFund #### References * Repository * Simulation post upgrade * Documentation * Fork tests: Shortfall, RiskFund, RiskFund swaps, reduce reserves * Community post: Risk Fund and Shortfall Handling Module Deployment

title: VIP-171 XVS Emission Reduction
description: #### Summary After the successful passing of the snapshot vote to reduce XVS emissions earlier this week, this VIP is now being issued for the changes to be implemented and take effect immediately after its execution. If approved by the majority of XVS Holders, this VIP will reduce the amount of daily XVS emission on Venus Core pool markets. The current emission on the core pool markets is 1,449.55 XVS/day, and after the change the daily emission of XVS in the markets will be 362.38625 XVS/day. #### Reasoning With the upcoming launch of the Venus Prime program and current market trends, this proposal aims to further reduce XVS emissions on Venus Core markets by 75%. The new organic reward system for this program will help offset the effects. The goal is to keep reducing token inflation and with it, support protocol growth and reinvestment. #### Venus Prime Program Overview Venus Prime stands as a strategic shift in the Venus Protocol’s reward mechanism. Diverging from the traditional token emission method, Venus Prime is engineered to distribute rewards based on protocol performance. This organic reward system is expected to drive user engagement and loyalty, while simultaneously reducing dependency on regular emissions which can contribute to token inflation and associated market pressures. #### Mitigating Impact of Emission Reduction with Venus Prime Organic Rewards: Venus Prime eliminates the need for frequent token emissions, thus reducing the inflationary pressures on the XVS token. Incentivizing Long-Term Engagement: With Venus Prime, users are not just rewarded for mere participation but for their loyalty and consistent engagement with the protocol. This ensures that while emissions are cut, user retention and attraction remain high. The shift towards a sustainable rewards model ensures that the Venus Protocol remains financially robust, aligning the interests of users with the protocol’s long-term viability. #### Conclusion The Venus Prime program offers a sustainable and innovative solution to the challenges posed by regular token emissions. By harnessing the protocol’s own revenues for user rewards and fostering an environment of long-term engagement, Venus Prime ensures that the proposed emission reductions not only maintain but enhance the protocol’s market position and user appeal.

title: VIP-172 Add forced liquidations feature into the Core pool
description: #### Summary If passed, this VIP will upgrade the implementation of the Comptroller contract of the Core pool, including the feature “forced liquidations” as suggested by Chaos Labs. #### Description This VIP upgrades the implementation of the Comptroller contract in the core pool, including the feature “forced liquidations”, that will be initially disabled for every market. If “forced liquidations” are enabled for a market, borrow positions can be liquidated in that market even when the health rate of the user is greater than 1 (i.e. when the account is collateralized). Additionally, the close factor check is ignored, allowing the liquidation of 100% of the debt in one transaction. This feature is based on the implementation done by Compound V2 here. Compound V2 allows “forced liquidations” on markets as soon as the Collateral factor is zero, the Reserve factor is 100% and the borrows are paused. Venus defines a feature flag to enable/disable “forced liquidations”, configurable directly via VIP, not based on other parameters. To check if “forced liquidations” are enabled in one market, the function _Comptroller.isForcedLiquidationEnabled(address vToken)_ can be called on the Comptroller contract of the pool, providing the address of the market to check. Finally, this VIP will authorize Normal, Fast-track and Critical timelocks to enable and disable the forced liquidations on any market of the Core pool. #### Security and additional considerations We applied the following security procedures for this upgrade: * Behavior post upgrade: in a simulation environment, validating “forced liquidations” work as expected after the upgrade * Deployment on testnet: the same implementation has been deployed to testnet, and used in the Venus Protocol testnet deployment * Audit: Certik and Peckshield have audited the deployed code #### Audit reports * Certik audit report (2023/09/16) * Peckshield audit report (2023/09/16) #### Deployed contracts * New Comptroller implementation - mainnet * New Comptroller implementation - testnet #### References * Pull request with the changeset * Simulation post upgrade * Comptroller proxy contract in the core pool (Unitroller) * Documentation

title: VIP-174 Core pool Comptroller upgrade – Diamond Comptroller
description: #### Summary If passed this VIP will upgrade the implementation of the Comptroller contract in the Core pool. It will set a re-architectured Comptroller following the Diamond pattern, not adding new features now for the regular users. This upgrade will allow Venus to add new features in the Core pool in the future, unlocking the EVM limitation on the size of the contracts (maximum 24KB) added in the EIP-170. #### Description This VIP upgrades the implementation of the Comptroller contract in the Core pool. As features continued to be introduced to the Core Pool Comptroller contract, it grew to exceed the maximum allowable size of 24KB. In response to this challenge and to preemptively address similar issues in the future, a multifaceted diamond pattern was implemented. The original comptroller was refactored using the EIP-2535 diamond pattern into distinct facets. This restructuring aligns the storage layout with that of the Comptroller proxy, streamlining the contract's organization and enhancing efficiency. As a consequence user interactions now trigger two delegate calls. Users will continue to interact with the Unitroller proxy contract same as before with one significant difference. Now the Diamond proxy serves as the implementation contract for the Unitroller, and the Comptroller's implementation has been divided into multiple facets. These facets will function as the various components of the Diamond proxy. Facets: * PolicyFacet: this facet contains all the external pre-hook functions related to vToken. * SetterFacet: this facet contains all setter configuration functions. * MarketFacet: this facet provides information about the asset in the market that you are in at that time. This facet is also responsible for entering and exiting the market. * RewardFacet: this facet provides the external functions related to all claims and rewards of the protocol, it has the following. You can see more technical details about the Diamond Comptroller in the documentation site. Security and additional considerations We applied the following security procedures for this upgrade: * Comptroller contract behavior post upgrade: in a simulation environment, validating Comptroller work as expected after the upgrade * Comptroller storage layout: in a simulation environment, validating the storage variables are accessible and correct after the upgrade * Deployment on testnet: the same Diamond Comptroller has been deployed to testnet, and used in the Venus Protocol testnet deployment * Audit: OpenZeppelin, Quantstamp, Certik, Peckshield and Fairyproof have audited the deployed code Audit reports * OpenZeppelin audit report (2023/08/17) * Quantstamp audit report (2023/09/19) * Certik audit audit report (2023/08/03) * Peckshield audit report (2023/07/28) * Fairyproof audit report (2023/06/25) Deployed contracts on main net * Comptroller proxy (Unitroller) * Current Comptroller implementation * New Comptroller implementation (Diamond) * Facets on mainnet: * MarketFacet * PolicyFacet * RewardFacet * SetterFacet References * Pull request with the changeset * Simulation pre and post upgrade * Documentation

title: VIP-181 Fix on the Diamond Comptroller configuration
description: #### Summary If passed this VIP will apply a fix in the configuration of the Diamond Comptroller deployed at VIP-174. It doesn’t involve any code change or contract upgrade. #### Description VIP-174 didn't include the config in the Diamond Comptroller to route the function "venusInitialIndex()" to a specific facet. So, when the Diamond Comptroller receives the call to invoke that function (from the VenusLens contract, for example) it throws the error "Diamond: Function does not exist". The solution, proposed in this VIP, is to add a route in the Diamond Comptroller for the missing function. It could be routed to any facet, because the public constant "venusInitialIndex" is defined in the parent contract FacetBase, extended by every facet. This VIP proposes to route it to the MarketFacet, where the "venusInitialIndex" constant is already used. - Sighash of "venusInitialIndex()": 0xc5b4db55 (used to identify the invoked function) - Market facet in mainnet: 0x40A30E1B01e0CF3eE3F22f769b0E437160550eEa Security and additional considerations This VIP doesn’t involve any code change or contract upgrade. We applied the following security procedures for this configuration change: - Comptroller contract behavior post upgrade: in a simulation environment, validating Comptroller works as expected after the configuration update, specifically the access to the function "venusInitialIndex()" - Comptroller storage layout: in a simulation environment, validating the storage variables are accessible and correct after the upgrade - Deployment on testnet: the same configuration change has been applied to the Diamond Comptroller deployed to testnet, and used in the Venus Protocol testnet deployment Deployed contracts on main net - Comptroller proxy (Unitroller) - Comptroller implementation (Diamond) References - Simulation pre and post upgrade - Documentation

title: VIP-183 Quarterly XVS Buyback and Funds Allocation
description: #### Description VIP-183 relates to the Quarterly Venus Protocol XVS Buyback & Funds allocation as indicated in our Tokenomics. #### Specifications As per our Tokenomics v.3.1, this VIP will proceed to withdraw funds for our Quarterly Buyback and distributions. The complete details on our latest tokenomics are available here: Revision of Venus Tokenomics Exceptionally for this quarter, we are proposing sending the BNB exploiter liquidation fees to the risk fund to be used towards active shortfalls repayment which will greatly benefit Venus in the long term. Due to the depreciation of BUSD and TUSD (OLD), we will not be able to withdraw those reserves as there is no available liquidity. They will be withdrawn at a later date and we can proceed to adjust the distributions then. title: VIP-186 Add forced liquidations feature into the Isolated pools
description: #### Summary If passed, this VIP will upgrade the implementation of the Comptroller contracts of the Isolated pools, including the feature “forced liquidations”. This feature was already added to the Comptroller contract of the Core pool in the VIP-172. Forced liquidations will be initially disabled for every market in Isolated pools. To enable it, a new VIP would be needed. #### Description This VIP upgrades the implementation of the Comptroller contracts in the Isolated pools, including the feature “forced liquidations”, that will be initially disabled for every market. You can read more about this feature in the VIP-172, and in the public documentation site. Finally, this VIP will authorize Normal, Fast-track and Critical timelocks to enable and disable the forced liquidations on any market of the Isolated pools. Security and additional considerations We applied the following security procedures for this upgrade: - Behavior post upgrade: in a simulation environment, validating “forced liquidations” work as expected after the upgrade - Deployment on testnet: the same implementation has been deployed to testnet, and used in the Venus Protocol testnet deployment - Audit: Certik has audited the deployed code Audit reports - Certik audit report (2023/10/16) Deployed contracts - New Comptroller implementation - mainnet - New Comptroller implementation - testnet References - Pull request with the changeset - Simulation post upgrade - Old Comptroller implementation - Beacon contract - Documentation
